channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Crypto spam bots go silent while Musk promises to prosecute scammers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: Some users in the crypto Twitter space are already reporting a reduction in the number of scam bots after Elon Musk’s latest changes to the social media platform.

item.title: SBF wants to start a new business, officially added as hearing witness
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: With FTX creditors numbering over one million and owed up to $50 billion, FTX’s old CEO said he’s interested in starting a business to repay them all.

item.title: Terra co-founder Do Kwon hiding out in Serbia, authorities say
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.category: South Korea Ministry of Foreign Affairs
item.description: South Korean authorities have requested cooperation from the Serbian government in order to bring Kwon back to face charges in South Korea.

item.title: Bitcoin’s boring price action allows XMR, TON, TWT and AXS to gather strength
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: BTC’s price range is tightening in preparation for a potential range expansion. Meanwhile, XMR, TON, TWT and AXS are maintaining their bullish momentum.

item.title: 3Commas denies staff members stole API keys
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Crypto trading firm also rejects claim that users' API keys were leaked and urges users to file a police report.

item.title: Binance's proof of reserves raises red flags: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Corporate structure, Bitcoin liabilities and internal control quality are among the points of concern.

item.title: Former top SEC crypto regulator hired by Caroline Ellison
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Ex-Alameda Research head will be represented by Stephanie Avakian and a team of attorneys from WilmerHale.

item.title: Lodestar Finance exploited in flash loan attack
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The main vulnerability behind the attack was a plvGLP oracle, which the attacker was able to manipulate.

item.title: SBF 'didn't like' decentralized Bitcoin — ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin was beyond the control of Sam Bankman-Fried, Wood says, while Michael Saylor says the former FTX CEO "undermined" the BTC network.

item.title: Abnormal token price movements on Binance not hack-related, confirms CZ
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: On Dec. 11, Binance issued a notice about abnormal price movements for some trading pairs. As a result, the exchange began an investigation to narrow down suspicious accounts responsible for the issue.

item.title: FTT investors' claims to be investigated for securities laws violations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: To help the investors legally recoup losses, Schall Law Firm plans to investigate FTX for issuing misleading statements or failing to disclose crucial information.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s parents no longer on the Stanford Law School roster
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Joseph Bankman and Barbara Fried have started facing professional consequences for their child Sam Bankman-Fried's illegal actions.

item.title: A Supreme Court case could kill Facebook and other socials — allowing blockchain to replace them
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nick Daze
item.description: If the Supreme Court decides to strike down Section 230, it's going to become considerably more difficult for centralized social media companies to operate.

item.title: Goldman Sachs buying crypto firms, FTX news, 3AC and Celsius updates: Hodler’s Digest Dec. 4-10
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff

item.title: SBF tried to destabilize crypto market to save FTX: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Trades made by Alameda Research were reportedly focusing on depeg Tether's stablecoin.

item.title: 5 tips for investing during a global recession
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nathan Thompson
item.description: The market may be experiencing some tough days, but that doesn’t have to stop you from finding ways to prosper.

item.title: Bitcoin price liquidation risk increases as BTC struggles to reclaim $18K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Leveraged long margin traders are playing with a hot potato, and with BTC struggling at $17,000, they might get burned sooner than later.

item.title: Binance suspends trader’s account after complaints on Twitter
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao said the firm doesn’t want to service “unreasonable” clients.

item.title: Yuga Labs, Moonpay faces lawsuit over celebrities NFT promotion
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Over 40 people and companies are named as defendants in the lawsuit, including Paris Hilton, Snoop Dog, Jimmy Fallon, Justin Bieber, Madonna.

item.title: What is spot trading in crypto and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Onkar Singh
item.category: traders can immediately exchange their cryptocurrency for fiat currency or another cryptocurrency by placing a buy or sell order.
item.description: In a spot market, traders can immediately exchange their cryptocurrency for fiat currency or another cryptocurrency by placing a buy or sell order.

item.title: Gensler’s approach toward crypto appears skewed as criticisms mount
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shiraz Jagati
item.description: While the SEC chairman has promised to make crypto safer for everyone, the recent slew of company collapses seems to suggest otherwise.

item.title: Bitcoin bulls protect $17K as trader eyes key China BTC price catalyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: China offers a potential leading indicator for Bitcoin price strength with U.S. economic data due next week.

item.title: Florida best-prepared US state for widespread crypto adoption: Research
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: While U.S. the most dominant player in crypto, a state-wise analysis reveals that not all 50 states are equally prepared for the inevitable mainstream crypto adoption.

item.title: US DOJ reportedly investigating FTX CEO for siphoning funds out of the US
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The anonymous informant revealed that DOJ officials met with FTX’s court-appointed overseers to discuss the scope of the information they need for further investigation.

item.title: Bahamian attorneys pursue access to FTX data of international customers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The Bahamian attorneys filed an emergency motion with a Delaware bankruptcy judge requesting access to FTX’s customer database to aid their ongoing investigations.

item.title: Data shows the Bitcoin mining bear market has a ways to go
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: The 2022 bear market is impacting BTC miners in more extreme ways than previous downturns, especially with so many publicly listed miners struggling with their debt obligations.

item.title: Ethereum and Litecoin make a move while Bitcoin price searches for firmer footing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Big Smokey
item.category: is the crypto bear market over
item.description: Bitcoin price aims for support at $17,000, while LTC follows a pre-halving narrative and ETH looks somewhat bullish in its BTC pair.

item.title: Who’s expected to testify before Congressional hearings on FTX?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: FTX CEO John Ray, actor Ben McKenzie and law professor Hilary Allen have been confirmed, while SBF, Kevin O'Leary and Alameda CEO Caroline Ellison could still testify.

item.title: A year after Taproot, Bitcoin community works to unlock its DeFi potential
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Smart contracts functionalities on the Bitcoin network could boost adoption and provide additional liquidity to DeFi.

item.title: US regulator seeks feedback on DeFi’s impact on financial crime: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: US regulators want to know from the industry on what they think about the financial crimes associated with DeFi.
